headline: 3-Ingredient Peanut Butter Cookies
description: These 3-ingredient peanut butter cookies are naturally gluten-free, ready in less than 30 minutes, and use pantry staples you probably have on hand.

video.description: If peanut butter is your thing, these simple, three ingredient cookies are just for you!
video.name: 3-Ingredient Peanut Butter Cookies

name: 3-Ingredient Peanut Butter Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Mix peanut butter, sugar, and egg together in a bowl using an electric mixer until smooth and creamy.
Roll mixture into 1-inch balls and place 1 inch apart on an ungreased baking sheet
Flatten each with a fork, making a criss-cross pattern.
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are firm, about 10 minutes. Cool on the baking sheet briefly before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

I doubled the recipe I also did half granulated half brown sugar my husband's favorite have to make at least once a week he takes some to share with coworkers they tell me I need to sell them to them ' I could make a killing'
Love love love! Mine are 4 ingredient though, mini chocolate chips
Few ingredients, simple instructions, great results. I made mini cookies for a tea. I'll definitely make them again.
These are so delicious wonderful for a dessert or gathering super easy aswell
Used brown sugar and cut the amount of sugar called for in half. Also did a double batch. One of my families favorites.

These cookies are the most simple recipe I've seen and they come out better than the traditional peanut butter cookies that require of all those extra ingredients. It is simply delicious and amazing! The entire family loves them. I did cut the amount of sugar( I used light brown sugar) to half of the amount and added 2 teaspoons of vanilla to them also. I tried making a batch with chocolate chips in them and it ruined the peanut butter cookie in my opinion. I have shared this recipe with my father as well as my Grandmother and they use it too! It is a great recipe for my Grandmother because it doesn't have a bunch of ingredients to remember or steps to make them. Thank you for sharing such a wonderful useful recipe.
I think these are the best! So easy; so yummy, and gluten free!

I made the cookies with unsweetened peanut butter and they turned out fantastic. I made them as drop cookies and did not flatten them. I take them from the oven before they are fully cooked since they continue to bake on the cookie sheet. This makes them soft and chewy.

This is a really easy and tasty recipe that doesn't take very many ingredients, and yet, still tastes fantastic. Anyone can make these, and in in a short amount of time too! ONE TIP: Add around a teaspoon or two of Vanilla Extract, which helps make the cookies ingredients blend together and improves the taste.
I prefer my peanut butter cookies chewy, so I use only brown sugar for these. White sugar makes them too hard, especially after a day or so.
it is an alsome resopey

This recipe is delicious! I cut the amount of sugar in half so instead of a full cup of sugar I used a half cup so a little less sweet. I also added a teaspoon of pure vanilla extract. Peanutbuttery Heaven. I made my cookies a little bit bigger so instead of 24 little cookies I got 10 big ones. üòä
I tried this recipe with 1/2 c white sugar and 1/2 c brown sugar.
I added a dash of vanilla and they were fine. Kids loved themm

Made the cookies as the recipe stated. They were easy and tasty and only three ingredients. These are great stand-alone cookies or as a base to tweak as you like. As written, it is a great recipe - go for it ! I am a bit confused about one thing. Someone wrote a review giving this recipe only two stars. Was it because you did not care for the cookies or the fact that you over-cooked them on your open grill??? First off, why grill cookies on an open fire then expect positive results. Second, why even write a review for this when you did not follow the instructions Delete your review, it throws of the rating curve. Somebody else stated that it "grinds their gears" when reviews are written for a recipe they changed. Agreed! If you change it, then it is not the same recipe.

My family loves these. So quick and easy. I've actually randomly made these at my sister's house for my nieces and nephews. Cookies from staples we usually keep on hand. I've added chocolate chips a time or few. It's great as is, but also as a base for new baker's.

Very Good, will be making these often. I put mini morsels of chocolate chips on top and sprinkled very little sugar on them!!
Recipe is easy and did not make any changes .they are by far the easiest and so so good. Will definitely make again and again.
This is a great peanut butter cookie. I always use this recipe to make my peanut butter blossoms with Hershey kisses but the cookies are great plain too!

I added and exchanged ingredients, as well as doubled it. I used 1 cup brown sugar instead of white - 2 medium eggs - 1 cup natural honey peanut butter and 1 cup natural almond butter. Then I added two table spoons honey pecan Philadelphia cream cheese. I baked them at 350 for 14 minutes. They are creamy not crunchy and soft . Very delicious and gooey when eating warm
These are the best peanut butter cookies the kids devoured them!
I loved it you should try it with crunchy peanut butter.
Super easy, delicious and quick! For kids and adults who don‚Äôt like their cookies super sweet, I recommend 1/3 cup sugar. It‚Äôs actually sweet enough!!

Loved it recipe was quick easy and taste great
Easy a simple to make with the kids. And they love it!

Love this recipe. It‚Äôs quick and easy and everyone loves them

My kids loved it.

I love this recipe. I'm not overly picky, so this was just fine for me taste (really just tastes like a peanut butter cookie tbh) and texture-wise‚ÄîI really just wanted a quick and easy sweet recipe that required the minimum amount of ingredients that I have. Came out just fine! I had to stop myself from eating all of them in one go! Definitely the way to go.
The cookie dough was a little stickier and hard to do a cross shape on. Overall a quick and easy (and delicious) recipe!
Adding a hint of vanilla makes these cookies 100% better. And make sure not to mix the dough too much or they will turn out quite grainy.
I loved them, the cookie dough was really sticky so I hat to use butter to stop it from sticking

I decreased the temp to 325¬∞ put them on the top shelf and cooked for 12-14 min and I make these all the time, they are ready at the go. I also used super chunk peanut butter ( all natural ) and sprinkled a little sugar on top, just a tiny bit. Hubby has had me make his w peanut butter chips, chocolate chips, and once with powdered sugar not granulated sugar on top ( not all at onceüòÅ) (Men like all that stuff, I'm happy with plain perfect peanut butter cookies üòò. I definitely recommend this recipe, it's fast, easy to prepare and remember, and they turn out great. I think he wants marshmallows next time lol.
it is amazing it tastes super good!

great, though i added vanilla to it. today i'm going to put chocolate chips in it. however, "flattening it with a fork" is a pretty funny suggestion. i'm wondering how anyone manages to do that without the dough sticking to the form. i just used my hands; they look better anyway.

If you have the time or ability to make cookies with flour, do that. The peanut butter and the sugar are both overpowering without the flour to balance them out. That said, this came out impressively good for what it is, and I will definitely save it for low spoon days or visitors with gluten intolerance.
Came out perfect
Fantastic and soooo easy.
It's easy to make when you are on a tight schedule and they are delicious.. Chewy too
Turned out great and it was super easy!

Very easy to make and tasty. Because the cookie ingredients are only peanut butter, egg and sugar, it was too sweet. I used Jif PB. I like a crispier cookies, so decided against using brown sugar. Will continue to play with the recipe. It is sure to be a hit with the kids and those with a sweet tooth.
Short, sweet and to the point! Made in a couple minutes. Look good, and, will taste in a few minutes
I added 1/2 cup of oats, 1 tsp vanilla, and 1 bananna and omitted sugar. Was good and healthy, but missed the sugar. So I sprinkled it on after baking!! Delish
Tastes great but really small
I used1/2 brown sugar and 1/2 white sugar 10 minutes is too long to bake them. They burnt.
Terrible. Don't waste your ingredients!
I added 1 peanut in the middle surrounded by 4 Hershey's Chocolate Chips. Thank you for the recipe. So easy to make and tasted great. PS, I used Peter Pan Creamy Peanut Butter.
Great lasted for ever made it gluten-free so amazingly delicious and so easy to make

Followed recipe exactly and found the dough to be so soft I was unable to roll the cookies in to balls. I finally used a cookie scoop but when I tried to press on the balls with a fork the dough crumbled. I may try again with brown sugar rather than granulated, otherwise I'll go back to my normal recipe.
I like that it is super easy to make... and I added chocolate chips to the batter! yum
So easy and cannot tell the difference. No extra butter or shortening! Yummy

Now that's a peanut butter cookie. I'm going to make another batch using Laura Scudder's peanut butter because there isn't any sugar in it and use monk fruit sweetener for a diabetic friend, to see if that makes a good cookie...

I already have a recipe similar. I add 1 teaspoon vanilla. I also let the dough sit in the refrigerator for about 10 minutes. It's easier to roll into balls without to much of a mess. Love these cookies. Glad to see this recipe shared.
This is my goto peanut butter cookie recipe! And you can put them into a cookie press to make some really pretty shapes.
I followed the directions, except I doubled it. I rolled them into a ball and my thumb in the middle and added chocolate chips to some and m&ms to others. They were awesome!

I made this recipe last year to give as Christmas gifts,and people went bananas over them! I added chocolate chips to half of the recipe. Folks couldn't decide which they enjoyed more! I usually give cupcakes along with the cookies. This year, I asked which they wanted. With the exception of one friend who wants both, everyone wanted the cookies! Thanks for such a great recipe!
Absolutely love these and super easy to make????

I've made these cookies many many times now and they are always a huge hit! I use nutty PB simply because I'm a nutty gal! I also add chocolate chips which puts them over the top yummy! 3 ingredients, yes please! It's pure chemistry & magic! Try them as a sandwich cookie with your favorite jelly, OMGoodness!
So glad I made these! Super easy and delicious and perfect for any occasion. I made them for my family recently and they loved it!

MUCH too sweet as is, I did 3/4 C sugar to 1C peanut butter.... a bit better... pressed some bittersweet chocolate chips into some, and some apricot jam into others, both helped fight the overly sweet sensation. I also had to bake longer than stated and a little longer. Mine did best when I pulled them out, waited 3 minutes for them to set, a little, and flipped them, before finishing the last few minutes of the bake.
Turned out amazing

I was very skeptical when I saw this recipe. Cookies without flour? I read a number of reviews and brought out the three ingredients. I only did one thing different and that was add about a quarter cup of quick oats because the mix seemed a bit oily. Well I must admit they turned out good but not 5 star good. Others said they weren't sweet enough but after one cookie I was pouring a glass of milk and I like sweet stuff! I'm glad I didn't roll them in sugar like one person suggested. They were easy enough to make and satisfied my sweet tooth.

They came out great! I actually learned this recipe in county jail! I hadn't made them in a long time, so I had to look up the specific cooking temperature and time, but they are just as great as I remember! My kids love the cookies that mom learned on to make on "vacation". Shout out to the MCCF kitchen workers and to you as well, Heather! ??
Easy peasy! I reduced the sugar by half as well as there is sugar in peanut butter. They turned out very good.
Tastes HEAVENLY! So chewy and yummy. I made a small batch and added a little bit of vanilla extract. I'll be using this recipe a lot in the future!!
They are drier then I like but you can remedy that by adding an egg. 1 cup Peanut butter 1 cup sugar 2 eggs. Everything else the same.
It was dry, falling apart as I was taking them off the cookie sheet. I wonder if I added an egg would that work...
There is no way you can get 24 cookies. I made 11- 2 inch cookies. I substituted Stevia for the sugar and they were tasty but crumbly.
So i added nutella and used crunchy peanut butter and left it in the oven for 4 more minutes and it was amazing
